title: Machine Learning Applications for Predicting Chemical Sensor Performance

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A training course combining immediately applicable chemical sensor analysis techniques with machine learning algorithms. Enhances field adaptability through predictive model training using real experimental data

learning_goals: Learners can quantify the correlation between physical properties of chemical sensors (porosity, electrochemical characteristics) and performance metrics (sensitivity, detection limit).
Learners can analyze chemical sensor data using linear regression models and achieve prediction accuracy of over 85%.
Learners can apply machine learning models to real industrial samples (food, beverages, etc.) to estimate analyte concentrations with an error rate within 10%.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
